poem:
### Fractures in the Sand

Hope flickers like a candle  
Against the desert's breath;  
In the sudden silence,  
Lies the pause before the storm.  
Across fractured earth,  
The sky drops its heavy fruit—  
And against thin canvas,  
Dreams unravel,  
Thread by painful thread,  
Into dust-choked despair.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I feel like we are in a trap’: Gaza residents hopeful but wary of Trump’s plan When Arij al-Farra heard that Hamas had partially agreed to Donald Trump’s plan and that the US president had ordered Israel to stop bombing Gaza, the first thing she felt was a flicker of hope. The second thing she felt was an explosion. An Israeli aircraft had dropped a bomb close to her tent in Khan Younis, southern Gaza.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
